title: AbstractGridRepresentation
description: The group of elements contained by all different kind of grids

InterpretationID.title: ID of the interpretation
InterpretationID.description: The reference to the EarthModelInterpretation this grid belongs to.

ActiveCellCount.title: Total count of active cells
ActiveCellCount.description: Total count of active cells in the grid. It is an approximation since the real count of active cells can be modified with some properties.

HasNaNGeometry.title: Has NaN Geometry
HasNaNGeometry.description: Indicate that at least on coordinate of one node of the grid is NaN. It is different than a dead cell which may have a geometry while it is disabled.

ParentGridID.title: Parent Grid ID
ParentGridID.description: Reference to the parent grid. If present, it means that this grid is a Local GridRefinement.

StratigraphicUnits.title: Stratigraphic Units
StratigraphicUnits.description: Allow to link the K layers (or the "geologic k" property for example in case of K expansion or unstructured grid) of this grid with some stratigraphic units of a stratigraphic organization.

StratigraphicUnitsIndices.title: StratigraphicUnitsIndices
StratigraphicUnitsIndices.description: For each K layer, indicate the corresponding stratigraphic unit indices within the associated Stratigraphic Organization. A negative value means that a K layer is not related to any stratigraphic unit (salt for example)

StratigraphicColumnRankInterpretationID.title: Stratigraphic Column Rank Interpretation ID
StratigraphicColumnRankInterpretationID.description: Reference to the stratigraphic column rank interpretation which this grid is derived from.

RockFluidOrganizationInterpretationIDS.title: Array of references to RockFluidOrganizationInterpretation
RockFluidOrganizationInterpretationIDS.description: References to the RockFluid organization interpretations which this grid relates to.

HasFiniteElementSubnodes.title: Has Finite Element Subnodes
HasFiniteElementSubnodes.description: Indicate if the grid has got some finite element subnodes for defining higher order grid geometry and properties. This is mainly used in geomechanical context.

HasNoGeometry.title: Has no geometry
HasNoGeometry.description: Indicate that the grid has no geometry. It is common when one wants a grid only as a collection of cell connections (i.e. pipe network).
